content:
Winchester College is committed to providing a supportive and inclusive environment that caters to the needs of students with different learning abilities and preferences. Here are some ways that Winchester College supports its students:

1. Individualized Learning: Winchester College recognizes that every student has unique learning abilities and preferences. Hence, they offer individualized learning support and advice to help students succeed. The School provides academic mentors to students that need additional support with their studies.

2. Special Educational Needs (SEN) Support: For students with identified support needs or disabilities, Winchester College provides Special Educational Needs support. The SEN team work closely with teachers in order to provide a range of support options, including extra one-to-one or small group support.

3. Student-Led Learning: Winchester College encourages student-led learning in its academic programs. This approach to learning allows students to direct their education and pursue topics and skills that capture their passion and interests.

4. Different Learning Styles: The School recognizes that different students process information differently. Therefore, they aim to cater for different learning styles, for example, kinesthetic, visual or auditory, in their teaching styles.

5. Cultural Diversity: Winchester College has a diverse student population with different cultural and linguistic backgrounds. Teachers cultivate inclusive and welcoming classrooms that respect, celebrate and learn from different cultures, and backgrounds.

Overall, Winchester College places a high priority on promoting academic excellence whilst ensuring the individual needs and wellbeing of its students.
